monitoring.title: Monitoring SSH/SFTP Logins
monitoring.description: Monitoring SSH/SFTP connections and sends Telegram notifications when it detects a new access.

excluded_ips.title: Excluded IPs from Monitoring
excluded_ips.placeholder: Enter IPs to exclude (one per line)
excluded_ips.description: IP addresses entered here will not generate SSH/SFTP access notifications. Supports single IPs (e.g. 192.168.1.100) and CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.178.0/24)

alerts.title: Monitoring and Alert System
alerts.global_description: Enable/disable the entire monitoring and notification system
alerts.hysteresis_description: Hysteresis delays alert sending only if the value exceeds the threshold for the specified time
alerts.disk_info: Configure mount points in the "Mount Points" section to enable disk monitoring.
alerts.network_description: Monitor internet connection and send notification when network reconnects after a disconnection.
alerts.config_reset_confirm: Are you sure you want to reset to default configuration? All current settings will be lost.
alerts.test_sent: Test message sent for {parameter}. Check Telegram.

languages.title: Language Management
languages.description: Manage available languages for the interface and Telegram bot. You can upload new translation files in JSON format.
languages.language_code_help: Enter the two-letter ISO 639-1 language code.
languages.translation_file_help: The file must contain all translation keys.
languages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete the {language} language?

info.title: Information
info.description: This application monitors SSH connections to the system and sends Telegram notifications when it detects a new access.
info.requirements: To use this application, you need to:
steps: Create a Telegram bot using BotFather and get the token
Get the chat ID where you want to receive notifications (can be your personal ID or a group ID)
Enter this data in the configuration form above
Test the connection to verify everything works correctly
features: SSH Monitoring - Detects and notifies SSH connections
Docker Management - Control Docker containers via Telegram
File Upload - Upload files to server via Telegram
System Resources - View CPU, RAM, disk and network
Alert System - Parameter monitoring with automatic notifications

cameras.title: Camera Management
cameras.name: Camera Name
cameras.iou_threshold_description: Intersection over Union threshold for filtering overlapping detections (lower = more strict)
cameras.save_images_description: When enabled, detection snapshots will be permanently saved to the server for all cameras

cameras.save_path_placeholder: Enter the path where to save snapshots

bot_messages.detection_started:
ğŸ¥ **AI Detection Started**

The AI detection system has been started and is monitoring the configured cameras.
bot_messages.detection_stopped:
ğŸ›‘ **AI Detection Stopped**

The AI detection system has been stopped.
bot_messages.detection_restarted:
ğŸ”„ **AI Detection Restarted**

The AI detection system has been restarted with the new settings.

bot_messages.welcome:
Welcome to Server Monitor Bot!

This bot allows you to monitor your server status and receive notifications when important events are detected such as SSH access or high resource usage.

Use /res to check current server status
Use /help to see all available commands
bot_messages.help:
Available commands:

/start - Start the bot
/help - Show this help message
/res - Display system resources
/docker - Manage Docker containers
/upload - Upload files to server
/download - Download files from server
/commands - Execute configured commands
/reboot - Restart server (requires confirmation)
bot_messages.reboot_confirm:
Are you sure you want to restart the server?

This action will cause a temporary interruption of all services.
bot_messages.reboot_in_progress:
Server reboot in progress...

The server will be restarted. This operation may take a few minutes.
The bot will be temporarily unavailable until the reboot is complete.
